GUSP816.name: The World System of Cities
GUSP816.description: Modern global economic restructuring. Social, economic, and political impacts on world system of cities.

GUSP817.name: China and Globalization
GUSP817.description: Theoretical debates and empirical discussions on current social, economic, environmental, and spatial challenges facing contemporary urban China in an era of globalization. Comparative and thematic approach.

GUSP868.name: Planning Resilience against Extreme Events
GUSP868.description: Theory on ephemeral planning and contemporary urbanism. Characteristics of disruptive technologies, disaster planning, and mega-events. Case studies of US and international cities in duress and recovery. Strategic and tactical planning, management practices, and ‘winging it’ in a state of exception. Implications for policy, management, operations, and planning.

GUSP970.name: Special Topics in Global Urban Studies
GUSP970.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
GUSP970.description: Contemporary, theoretical, or applied issues. Interdisciplinary or disciplinary approaches.

GUSP975.name: Global Research Capstone
GUSP975.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
GUSP975.description: Demonstration of student competence in urban theory and concepts, by writing, analysis, research, and evaluation via an original research project.
